sentences: Diane Peoples Waldrop, née Ray (September 1, 1945 – March 14, 2020) was an American pop and rock and roll singer of the early 1960s.
Ray was born in Gastonia, North Carolina.
Her musical career began after she won a talent contest on Big WAYS radio in Charlotte NC.
She is best known for her hit single, "Please Don't Talk to the Lifeguard", which reached #31 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart in 1963.
Diane Ray Waldrop died on March 14, 2020 at the age of 74.
